tit.e: Japanese leek (edible plant, Allium bakeri, Allium chinese)
Japanese leek (edible plant, Allium bakeri, Allium chinese)
Japanese leek (edible plant, Allium bakeri, Allium chinese)

sen.j: ラッキョウ（辣韮、薤、辣韭、学名 Allium chinense syn. Allium bakeri）は、ユリ科（ネギ科とする場合もある。）の多年草・野菜。
sen.e: Japanese leek (scientific name: Allium chinese syn. Allium bakeri) is herbaceous perennial as well as a vegetable which belongs to liliaceae (or alliaceae).
Japanese leek (scientific name: Allium chinese syn. Allium bakeri) is herbaceous perennial as well as a vegetable which belongs to liliaceae (or alliaceae).
Japanese leek (scientific name: Allium chinese syn. Allium bakeri) is herbaceous perennial as well as a vegetable which belongs to liliaceae (or alliaceae).

sen.j: 別名は「オオニラ」、「サトニラ」。
sen.e: It is also called "oonira" or "satonira".
It is also called "oonira" or "satonira."
sen.cmt: ピリオドをコーテーション内に移動しました。
sen.e: It is also called "oonira" or "satonira."
Characteristics
Characteristics
Characteristics

sen.j: 中国、ヒマラヤ地方が原産。
sen.e: Its place of origin is Himalayan region, China.
Its place of origin is Himalayan region, China.
Its place of origin is Himalayan region, China.

sen.j: 白色または紫色を帯びた白色の鱗茎を食用とする。
sen.e: Its bulbs which are white or purplish are used for food.
Its white or purplish bulbs are used for food.
sen.cmt: 前半部を全文修正しました。
sen.e: Its white or purplish bulbs are used for food.

sen.j: 特有の強い匂いと辛味を持つ。
sen.e: It has unique strong smell and a pungent taste.
It has unique strong smell and a pungent taste.
It has unique strong smell and a pungent taste.

sen.j: この匂いはニンニクやニラと同じアリル化合物である。
sen.e: This smell comes from allylic compound as it does with garlic and Chinese chive.
This smell comes from allylic compound as same as garlic and Chinese chive.
sen.cmt: it does with を same as に修正しました。
sen.e: This smell comes from allylic compound as same as garlic and Chinese chive.

sen.j: 主に塩漬け、甘酢漬け、醤油漬けで食べる。
sen.e: It is mainly eaten pickled in salt, sweetened vinegar, or soy sauce.
It is mainly eaten pickled in salt, sweetened vinegar, or soy sauce.
It is mainly eaten pickled in salt, sweetened vinegar, or soy sauce.

sen.j: カレーライスのつけあわせとして、福神漬とならんでポピュラーな存在である。
sen.e: It is popular as an accompaniment of curry and rice, along with Fukujinzuke (sliced vegetables pickled in soy sauce).
It is popular as a relish of curry and rice, along with Fukujinzuke (sliced vegetables pickled in soy sauce).
sen.cmt: an accompaniment を a relish に修正しました。
sen.e: It is popular as a relish of curry and rice, along with Fukujinzuke (sliced vegetables pickled in soy sauce).

sen.j: また薬効も多いとされている。
sen.e: It is said to have many effects of the medicine.
It is said to have many medical properties.
sen.cmt: effects of the medicine をmedical properties に修正しました。
sen.e: It is said to have many medical properties.

sen.j: 鳥取県（鳥取砂丘）・福井県（三里浜）の特産品である。
sen.e: It is a special product of Tottori Prefecture (Tottori Sand Dune) and Fukui Prefecture (Sanrihama Sand Dune).
It is a special product of Tottori Prefecture (Tottori Sand Dune) and Fukui Prefecture (Sanrihama Sand Dune).
It is a special product of Tottori Prefecture (Tottori Sand Dune) and Fukui Prefecture (Sanrihama Sand Dune).

sen.j: また沖縄県では「島らっきょう」または「ダッチョウ」と呼ばれる、一般的ならっきょうより小型で細いものがある。
sen.e: In Okinawa Prefecture, they have smaller and thinner kind of Japanese leek compared to the common variety, which is called "Shima-rakkyo (Okinawan shallots)" or "Daccho".
In Okinawa Prefecture, they have smaller and thinner kind of Japanese leek compared to the common variety, which is called 'Shima-rakkyo' (Okinawan shallots) or 'Daccho.'
sen.cmt: コーテーションの位置と種類を修正しました。
sen.e: In Okinawa Prefecture, they have smaller and thinner kind of Japanese leek compared to the common variety, which is called 'Shima-rakkyo' (Okinawan shallots) or 'Daccho.'

sen.j: 一般的なラッキョウよりもネギに似た辛みが強く、主に塩漬けして鰹節をかけて食べる。
sen.e: It has stronger pungent taste like green onion compared to common Japanese leek, and is eaten pickled in salt and with dried bonito.
It has stronger pungent taste like green onion compared to common Japanese leek, and is eaten pickled in salt and sprinkled dried bonito.
sen.cmt: with dried bonito を sprinkled dried bonito に修正しました。
sen.e: It has stronger pungent taste like green onion compared to common Japanese leek, and is eaten pickled in salt and sprinkled dried bonito.

sen.j: 鱗茎は、薤白（がいはく）という生薬名がある。
sen.e: Its bulbs have a name as a crude drug, Gaihaku.
Its bulbs have a name as a crude drug, "Gaihaku."
sen.cmt: Gaihaku にダブルコーテーションを追記しました。
sen.e: Its bulbs have a name as a crude drug, "Gaihaku."

sen.j: 漢方では胸痺（きょうひ、胸のつかえ・痛みなど）に効果があるとされる。
sen.e: In traditional Chinese medicine, it is said to have effects for heavy stomach, pain in the chest, etc.
In traditional Chinese medicine, it is said to have effects for heavy stomach, knot or pain in the chest, etc.
sen.cmt: 「つかえ」訳漏れのためknot or を追記して対応しました。
sen.e: In traditional Chinese medicine, it is said to have effects for heavy stomach, knot or pain in the chest, etc.

sen.j: 薤白が配合される方剤
sen.e: Variety of Chinese Medicine Which Contains Gaihaku
Variety of Chinese Medicine Which Contains Gaihaku
Variety of Chinese Medicine Which Contains Gaihaku

sen.j: 栝楼薤白白酒湯（かろがいはくはくしゅとう）
sen.e: Karogaihakuhakushuto
Karogaihakuhakushuto
Karogaihakuhakushuto

sen.j: 栝楼薤白半夏湯（かろがいはくはんげとう）
sen.e: Karogaihakuhangeto
Karogaihakuhangeto
Karogaihakuhangeto

sen.j: 枳実薤白桂枝湯（きじつがいはくけいしとう）
sen.e: Kijitsugaihakukeishito
Kijitsugaihakukeishito
Kijitsugaihakukeishito
